data.title: News
data.text:
June 6, 2018

CSAF presents French medal to WWII Army vet, AF civilian

At a ceremony overlooking the Department of Defense Warrior Games at the U.S. Air Force Academy, Colorado Springs, Colorado, June 2, 2018, Air Force Chief of Staff Gen. David L. Goldfein presented the French Legion of Honor to a World War II Army veteran for his efforts to liberate Western Europe in

June 1, 2018

Retired Air Force rated officers welcomed back on active duty

Retired Air Force rated officers with Air Force Specialty Codes 11X-pilot, 12X-combat systems officer or 13B-air battle manager are encouraged to apply for the Voluntary Retired Return to Active Duty Program to help alleviate manning shortages within the Air Force rated community.Also eligible to

June 1, 2018

Columbus AFB Library offers summer reading program

The Base Library urges families to get ready, get set, and go to the Library on June 18 to sign up for its Summer Reading Program. This year’s theme is Reading Takes You Everywhere!

May 24, 2018

CAFB honors Memorial Day, pays tribute to late pilot from Class 09-10

Members of the 14th Flying Training Wing along with family and friends of Maj. Andrew Becker gathered in the Kaye Auditorium here during a Memorial Day Ceremony and paid tribute to Becker during a special memorial service May 24. Becker, along with two other Airmen, were killed when their U-28A

May 24, 2018

Email changes to add inbox space, increase efficiency for CAFB users

In a few weeks, service members and employees at Columbus Air Force Base will notice a major improvement with their government email accounts.

May 24, 2018

Instructor pilot shares experience in AFW2 program before competing in Warrior Games

The end of an Easter egg hunt in 2017 brought Capt. Hunter Barnhill, 37th Flying Training Squadron instructor pilot, down to the ground as his body was trapped in a seizure.

May 24, 2018

CAFB Education Center is base’s education compass

All Airmen, service members and civilians are encouraged to use their educational benefits while they serve their country, yet some take for granted the opportunities offered to them.
